title: Vietnamese Americans
summary: Vietnamese Americans (Vietnamese: Người Mỹ gốc Việt) are Americans of Vietnamese ancestry.[5] They make up about half of all overseas Vietnamese (Vietnamese: Người Việt hải ngoại or Việt kiều also known as Kiều bào) and are the fourth-largest Asian American ethnic group after Chinese Americans, Filipino Americans, and Indian Americans. There are about 2.2 million people of Vietnamese descent residing in the U.S.
